citation.article-title: Humihabitans oryzae gen. nov., sp. nov.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Humihabitans oryzae sp. nov.
Humihabitans oryzae (o.ry′zae. L. gen. n. oryzae of rice, pertaining to the isolation of the type strain from rice paddy soil).
In addition to the characteristics that define the genus, it has the characteristics described below.
Cell length is 1.0–2.2 μm with a mean diameter of around 0.5 μm.
Growth occurs at pH 5–11 and at 8 and 40 °C.
In 1/5-strength nutrient agar medium, NaCl is tolerated up to 3 %.
d-Fructose, d-glucose, maltose, d-mannitol, d-mannose, sucrose, trehalose and d-xylose are assimilated, but l-arabinose, d-galactose, raffinose and l-rhamnose are not.

Esterase (C4), esterase lipase (C8), valine arylamidase, cystine arylamidase, trypsin, chymotrypsin, acid phosphatase, α-galactosidase, β-galactosidase and α-glucosidase are detected by the API ZYM enzyme assay; alkaline phosphatase, β-glucuronidase, N-acetyl-β-glucosaminidase, α-mannosidase and α-fucosidase are negative.
Weak reactions for lipase (C14), leucine arylamidase, naphthol-AS-BI-phosphohydrolase and β-glucosidase are detected in API ZYM tests.
The DNA G+C content of the type strain is 70 mol%.
The type strain, KV-657T (=NRRL B-24470T =NBRC 101802T), was isolated from rice paddy soil in Japan.
